nodes.text: The Weldii system was located in the Southern Core portion of the Core Worlds. The third orbital position within the system was occupied by the terrestrial mining world Weldii III.

Weldii III was home to a mining colony, and its population included members of the Aqualish, Human, Klatooinian, Mustafarian, and Rodian species. At some point, the local miners staged a rebellion, in which the gunrunner Praaelon Di sold weapons to both sides of the conflict.

Sometime between 1 BBY and 3.5 ABY, after Administrator Lenc, the Bith leader of Weldii III's mining colony, learned of Di's involvement in the rebellion, the administrator hired a group of bounty hunters and pirates to capture the arms dealer and bring him back to Weldii III. Lenc's agents were defeated by the gunrunner and his allies, and subsequently Di and his associates traveled to Weldii III, where they ultimately defeated Lenc and his underlings.

The Weldii system de facto first appeared via the appearance of Weldii III in "Shafted!," the final installment in "Unfinished Business," a series of three scenarios for use with the Wizards of the Coast Star Wars Miniatures game. The series was written by Sterling Hershey, and the third scenario was published on Wizards.com on March 22, 2007. The 2009 reference book The Essential Atlas first named the Weldii system and placed it in grid square L-13.

The narrative structure of the three scenarios of "Unfinished Business" is dependent on the gameplay outcome of each individual scenario. If the player representing Praaelon Di and his allies in-game is victorious in the first scenario, "Gunrunner," the second installment, "Well-Armed and Dangerous," is to be skipped, and the narrative proceeds with "Shafted!."

In addition, if in "Well-Armed and Dangerous" the player controlling the bounty hunters wins, Di is considered to be captured and brought back to Lenc on Weldii III, with "Shafted!" to be skipped. This article assumes that as many events as possible of "Unfinished Business" play out as described and that Di and his allies are defeated in "Gunrunner," yet triumph in "Well-Armed and Dangerous" and "Shafted!."
